Exaggerate: The claim that "Star Wars: Rogue One" was re-shot to add an anti-Trump scene is an exaggeration as there is no evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no credible evidence or sources provided to back it up.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reshoots for the film were politically motivated, which is not supported by any factual information.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the reshoots were a common practice for major studio films and were done to improve the overall quality of the film, as explained by the director Gareth Edwards.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the writers of the film made political comments on their Twitter feeds, but there is no evidence to suggest that they added an anti-Trump message during reshoots.
Understate: The claim understates the role of the writers' political comments in generating the boycott hashtag #DumpStarWars, as these comments were cited as one of the reasons for the boycott.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misinformation and spreading false rumors, as pointed out by the representative for Disney and the writer Gary Weitz.
